alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 1:09PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Quick Hitting Colder Storm Expected On Thursday... A weaker system, relatively speaking, will quickly sweep through the region out ahead of Friday and Saturday`s more potent atmospheric river event. This system will be colder in nature with snow levels starting at all elevations and gradually rising above Lake Tahoe by Thursday afternoon. Overall snow totals will be light, but some higher elevation impacts are possible. Up to 2 inches will be possible around Lake Tahoe and Truckee with 6 to 10 inches near the Sierra passes. Winter driving conditions are possible in the mountains, especially Thursday morning. Lower portions of Mono county, such as Bridgeport, may see little to no accumulation. Sierra ridges will gust 60-75 mph which may result in some mountain recreation impacts. Check with Caltrans or NDOT for the latest roadway conditions by downloading their apps, or calling 5 1 1.
